properties.media:imagetext:
INFLIGHT WORK RULES AMENDMENT (Rev. 5)
INSERT IN WORK RULES BINDER AFTER PAGE 1
Date: December 3, 2013
Topic: Cabin Positioning and Intact Crews
Chapter: 1 - Company and InFlight Seniority Systems
Section: New Section - Cabin Positioning (insert before "Section C.
Seniority Requirements for working as ITL')
Paragraph: N/A
Effective Date of Revision: March 1, 2014
Nature of Revision: New Section "Cabin Positioning" to be inserted
between Section B and Section C:
Revised Wording:
CABIN POSITIONING
1. At the start of a pairing, ITMs will select the cabin position they
wish to work (ITM #2 or ITM #3) for the duration of the pairing
based on InFlight Seniority. The ITL position will be filled as
defined in SECTION C - SENIORITY REQUIREMENTS FOR
WORKING AS ITL. Each ITM must remain in that position
throughout the duration of the pairing, unless otherwise
specified in SECTION C - SENIORITY REQUIREMENTS FOR
WORKING AS ITL.
If either ITM #2 or ITM #3 leaves the pairing, the vacated
position will be filled by the crewmember joining the pairing,
unless otherwise specified in SECTION C - SENIORITY
REQUIREMENTS FOR WORKING AS ITL. If both ITM #2 and ITM
#3 leave the pairing, the new crewmembers will fill the ITM #2
and ITM #3 positions in accordance with Paragraph 1 above.
Intent of Revisions:
1. To clarify that the cabin positions of intact crews will not be
disrupted by split trip pairings except when the ITL position is
affected.

Revised Wording:
CABIN POSITIONING
1. At the start of a pairing, ITs will select the cabin position they
wish to work (ITM #2 or ITM #3) for the duration of the pairing
based on InFlight Seniority. The ITL position will be filled as

REQUIREMENTS FOR WORKING AS ITL. If both ITM #2 and ITM
#3 leave the pairing, the new crewmembers will fill the ITM #2
and ITM #3 positions in accordance with Paragraph 1 above.
Intent of Revisions:
1. To clarify that the cabin positions of intact crews will not be
disrupted by split trip pairings except when the ITL position is
affected.
